content:
{{knowledge objective
|Identifiant=OIC-136-01-B
|Item_parent=Local, locoregional and general anaesthesia
|Item_parent_short=Local, locoregional and general anaesthesia
|Rank=B
|Intitle=Know the number of procedures performed annually, the five most frequent procedures
|Description=None
|Topic=Epidemiology
|Contributors=
|Order=1}}
More than 10 million anaesthetic procedures are carried out in France every year. More than 50% of these are performed on an outpatient basis, with a long-term target of 70%. The 5 most frequent procedures are :

- digestive endoscopies

- vaginal deliveries and caesarean sections

- operations on the crystalline lens

- surgery of the mouth and teeth

- carpal tunnel releases

question.title: What are the 5 most frequent anaesthetic procedures performed in France?

option_a.title: Digestive endoscopies, vaginal deliveries and caesarean sections, operations on the crystalline lens, surgery of the mouth and teeth, carpal tunnel releases

option_b.title: Digestive endoscopies, vaginal deliveries and caesarean sections, operations on the crystalline lens, carpal tunnel releases, and dental extractions

option_c.title: Digestive endoscopies, vaginal deliveries and caesarean sections, operations on the crystalline lens, carpal tunnel releases, and cataract operations

option_d.title: Digestive endoscopies, vaginal deliveries and caesarean sections, operations on the crystalline lens, carpal tunnel releases, and dental extractions are the 5 most frequent procedures

correct_option.title: A
correct_option.description: The first letter of the correct option
